translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Sobhita
The Elder Sudassana’s Birth Story
“On the bank of the Vinatā River
there was a fruit-bearing pilu tree;
Searching for a tree,
I saw the Leader of the World.
Seeing a flowering ketaka tree,
I cut off a stalk
and placed it on the Buddha,
Sikhī, the Kinsman of the World.
By what knowledge did you attain
the unshakable, immortal state?
I revere that knowledge,
Buddha, best of teachers, Great Sage.
Having made an offering to knowledge,🔽I saw a pilu tree;
I have attained that wisdom,
this is the fruit of the offering of knowledge.
In the past, thirty-one eons ago,
I placed a flower on the Buddha;

analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi  phala  itas terasa kappamhi
translated: I do not know of a bad destination,🔽this is the fruit of the offering of knowledge.
In the past, thirteen eons ago,🔽twelve times I was raised to the status of a fruit-bearer;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
I was a universal monarch, of great fruit.
The four analytical knowledges,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sudassano thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sudassanaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Sudassana recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Sudassana is finished.
